body_html:
@molyswu I'm confused.

Your original issue was running cifar10_multi_gpu_train.py, which looked like a corrupt downloaded data file.

Your latest update is about building a new pip package (which suggests re-running ./configure to build with GPU support).

Are these two separate issues?
body_text:
@molyswu I'm confused.
Your original issue was running cifar10_multi_gpu_train.py, which looked like a corrupt downloaded data file.
Your latest update is about building a new pip package (which suggests re-running ./configure to build with GPU support).
Are these two separate issues?
body:
@molyswu I'm confused.

Your original issue was running `cifar10_multi_gpu_train.py`, which looked like a corrupt downloaded data file.

Your latest update is about building a new pip package (which suggests re-running ./configure to build with GPU support).

Are these two separate issues?
